alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 24 at 3:01PM ChST until May 25 at 5:45AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tiyan has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Guam... * Until 545 AM ChST Thursday. * At 301 PM ChST, Doppler radar, before it went down, indicated very heavy rain moving into Guam. Automated rain gauges show rainfall in excess of 1 inch over the last hour. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches per hour with locally heavier rainfall rates. Additional rainfall amounts of 10 to 15 inches are possible, with locally 20 to 25 inches possible. With over 2 and half inches of rainfall over the previous 24 hours, soils are already saturated. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Considerable flash flooding is likely, even for locations that do not normally flood. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * All of Guam. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
